Item.name: Crawler Fins
Item.description: Fins of a once living Crawler. The scales and claws are mineral rich and can be deconstructed into carbon and calcium.

Item.name: Crawler Belly
Item.description: A bloated stomach of a Crawler. Looks like there might be something in it?

Item.name: Crawler Leg
Item.description: Extremity of a Crawler, it feels strangely hard and squishy, reeks of the sea. The bones and flesh can be deconstructed into calcium and magnesium or sold as cheap meat.

Item.name: Broodmother Skin
Item.description: A piece of thick skin that was left on the Broodmother. Terrestrial biology does not utilize aluminium however the high content in this outer skin makes it extremely durable when exposed to heat, it can also be deconstructed into carbon.

Item.name: Broodmother Breast
Item.description: The breast of a Crawler Broodmother, will not elaborate further. Can be used to heal crew members. Can be deconstructed into saline.

Item.name: Observer Organ
Item.description: A heavy heart shaped organ the size of a human head, the organometallic flesh is like rubbery bronze, It seems to still be giving off frequent pulses in various frequencies and particles. While slightly hazaordous, scientists would be very interested in this.

Item.name: Horn Shrimp shell
Item.description: The heavy mineralized back of a Horn Shrimp. Rich in copper compounds, it flexes under extreme pressure without cracking.

Item.name: Razor Shrimp Fragment
Item.description: A thick organometallic fragment of the Razor Shrimp carapace. It appears to be biologically cemented alloy akin to black bronze made of copper but with titanium, It takes machinary to even bend this slightly and it instantly returns to its orginal form.

Item.name: Human Arm
Item.description: A torn human arm. discolored and reeking of brine due to some oceanic pickling process. Can be brought to merchantresearchers for data analysis.

Item.name: Human Leg
Item.description: A severed human leg. The bones are mysteriously fused and the flesh is hard and rubbery making time of death impossible. Can be brought to researchers for data analysis.

Item.name: Human Torso
Item.description: Chewed remains of a human, exhibiting partial ossification from unknown mineral or bacterial activity/ Can be brought to researchers for data analysis.

Item.name: Strange Meat
Item.description: Large pieces of flesh from a rare source. Can be brought to merchants or researchers for data analysis or just fed to pets or the deconstructor.

Item.name: Mudraptor Head Piece
Item.description: Armoured head exoskeleton of a Mudraptor. It feels heavy and rough. Can be deconstructed into iron and calcium.

Item.name: Mudraptor Claw
Item.description: The short hand of the Mudraptor. Its fingers are very sharp and can be used as a makeshift weapon. Deconstructs into titanium and calcium.

Item.name: Mudraptor Waist Piece
Item.description: Armoured waist piece of a Mudraptor. Despite being big, its lighter than the other major armoured pieces. Can be deconstructed into iron

Item.name: Charybdis Tongue
Item.description: The look of this thing makes you feel very uneasy as the bloody sharp end of this would easily rip you to shreds without the teeth.researchers will pay a large sum for these organs.

Item.name: Charybdis Stomach
Item.description: The gigantic stomach of the Charybdis. Maybe there's something valuable inside it? Researchers are willing to pay a lot for these organs.

Item.name: Tigerthresher Claws
Item.description: The claw like fin of the Tigerthresher. Small and dull. Can be deconstructed into iron.

Item.name: Tigerthresher Tail
Item.description: The tail of a Tigerthresher. Long and very rough the mineralized scales resemble bauxite. Can be deconstructed into aluminium.

Item.name: Bonethresher Claws
Item.description: The claw like fins of the Bonethresher. Bigger than the Tigerthresher, and much sharper. Can be used as a makeshift weapon, or be deconstructed into aluminium and iron.

Item.name: Bonethresher Tail
Item.description: The tail of a Bonethresher. Long and very rough the scales resemble bauxite with hematite intrusion. Can be deconstructed into iron and aluminium.

Item.name: Bonethresher Skin
Item.description: A piece of thick skin that was left on a Bonethresher. It feels really scaley and rough due to mineralized portions. Can be deconstructed into calcium and aluminium.

Item.name: Watcher Spikes
Item.description: The spiked parts of the Watcher's shell. It feels strangely squishy and inflates a bit. Can be deconstructed into sulphuric acid, carbon and rubber

Item.name: Watcher Eye Gel
Item.description: The vitreous gel of the Watcher. Deconstructs into sulphuric acid and zinc. In high demand with researchers or more generalized applications in colonies.

Item.name: Watcher Bursted Cornea
Item.description: The bursted len of the Watcher. Deconstructs into silicon and carbon. Researchers will pay quite a bit for this as will craftsmen in colonies.

Item.name: Moloch Pieces
Item.description: Large pieces of slimy flesh mixed with assorted materials taken from the body of a Moloch, highly valueable for study or crafting, Can be deconstructed into many materials.

Item.name: Moloch Shell Piece
Item.description: Cracked armour pieces taken from the dead Moloch. Often worked into high quality goods or as inlay though it can also be deconstructed for its base minerals.

Item.name: Hammerhead Arms
Item.description: The sharp stabbing fin of the Hammerhead. Its feels more like its was fabricated than grown and is absurdly sharp. Can be deconstructed into calcium and iron.

Item.name: Hammerhead Eye
Item.description: Eye of a Hammerhead. This one still glows a sickly green, like far off light in the great sea. Can be deconstructed into zinc and magnesium.

Item.name: Hammerhead Nose
Item.description: The very hard nose of the Hammerhead. Can be deconstructed into calcium and titanium.

Item.name: Golden Hammerhead Tail
Item.description: Rock solid and shines a lot, how does it turn when it is so stiff? Can be deconstructed into carbon, calcium, and iron.

Item.name: Golden Hammerhead Arms
Item.description: Sharp enough to damage submarine hulls and shines brilliantly. It somehow flexes like an organic fusion of metal and plastic. Can be deconstructed into titanium, silicon, and iron.

Item.name: Moloch Tentacles
Item.description: A piece of tentacle taken from a Moloch. Can be used as a emergency bandage. Can be deconstructed into a fauna derived elastin type material.

Item.name: Black Moloch Shell Piece
Item.description: Cracked armour pieces taken from a Black Moloch. Holding it makes you feel tense. Can be deconstructed into many merchantminerals.

Item.name: Black Moloch Tentacles
Item.description: A piece of tentacle taken from a Black Moloch. Can be used as a emergency bandage or seal. Can be deconstructed into animal elastin and lithium.

Item.name: Spineling Head
Item.description: The head pod of the Spineling. Feels hollow inside and there is a nasty mess in it. Deconstructs into zinc and carbon.

Item.name: Spineling Tail
Item.description: Tail part of the Spineling displaying its characteristic partly metal physiology. Deconstructs into magnesium and calcium.

Item.name: Giant Spineling Spike
Item.description: An extremely dense and razor sharp spine from a Giant Spineling. Can be processed into railgun munitions in a fabricator, sold for its diamond like properties or merely ground up for carbon and titanium.

Item.name: Giant Spineling Railgun Shell
Item.description: An extremely dense Giant Spineling spine, milled down to fit inside of a railgun casing. The words 'Return To Sender' are etched into the side.

Item.name: Giant Spineling Tail
Item.description: Rocky tail part of the Giant Spineling. Many small quills are attached with an organic plastic film. Deconstructs into zinc, plastic, iron, and calcium.

Item.name: Giant Spineling Head
Item.description: The ceramic like head pod of this particular Spineling, You wonder how the disquieting mess inside it functions as a brain. Deconstructs into zinc, iron, magnesium, and carbon.

Item.name: Mother Leatherback Fins
Item.description: The large piece of the Mother Leatherbacks fin. Hard and rough it can be ground and boiled into an edible jelly. Deconstructs into iron, carbon, titanium.

Item.name: Mother Leatherback Stomach
Item.description: Hard stomach of the Leatherback. Could be something inside?

Item.name: Mother Leatherback Skin
Item.description: Hard skin of the Leatherback. Merchants will pay top marks for the nearly bulletproof leather, The patchy mineralized sections can be crudely processed like undersea mineral nodules.

Item.name: Coelanth Fins
Item.description: The calcified fins of a once living Coelanth. Very big and scaly with surprising flexibility. Can be deconstructed into carbon, rubber and calcium.

Item.name: Coelanth Eyes
Item.description: The eyes of the Coelanth. It looks clouded and glows very bright. It can be deconstructed into zinc, lithium, phosphorus, and carbon.

Item.name: Mantis Claw
Item.description: Raptorial legs of the Mantis. Is relatively very sharp and proves to be a good melee weapon. Deconstructs into titanium, chitin, and iron.

Item.name: Mantis Leg
Item.description: Extremity of a Mantis, its limbs contain iron compounds which gives them a dull ochre color. Deconstructs into chitin, iron, and carbon.

Item.name: Shrimp Stomach
Item.description: Small belly of the Shrimp. Seems to be filled with mineralized nodules or other things while eating

Item.name: Shrimp Antenna
Item.description: Antenna used by the shrimp to feel, taste, and sense. Deconstructs into calcium

Item.name: Shrimp Claw
Item.description: Curved with an exceedingly sharp tip, Able to slice thick hides like a living linolium knife.

Item.name: Barracuda Fins
Item.description: Fins from a Barracuda. Long and stiffened the bony protusions require careful handling. Deconstructs into carbon and calcium.

Item.name: Barracuda Jaw
Item.description: Better not touch those teeth! Could still carry some poison on it. Deconstructs into calcium, iron, and paralyzant

Item.name: Barracuda Skin
Item.description: The beautiful white and blue skin of the Barracuda. These mineralized scales are in high demand from crew captains and administrators. This will likely result in the extinction of the Barracuda at some point.

Item.name: Husker Venom
Item.description: Extracted venom of a husker, the unique compounds form a complex and poorly understood cocktail of cyanide compounds buffered with organic compounds that function similar to stabilozine. Allows the cyanide to hyperoxygenate tissue causing a brief aderenaline like surge which is toxic to the husk parasite, Valueable and damgerous in the extreme, it can also be distilled into several more mundane chemicals.

Item.name: Fractal Machine Parts
Item.description: Mysterious machine parts of the Fractal Guardian. Researchers will pay a decent bounty for these.

Item.name: Fractal Ejector
Item.description: Fractal Guardians like to drag their intruders with this sort of device. Researchers will buy these for a fair amount.

Item.name: Fractal Biomechanic Parts
Item.description: Seems like the biomechanical organ-like life support of a expired Guardian. There is still a lot to learn from these machines. Researchers will buy these, often just for the rare materials inside.

Item.name: Fractal Steam Cannon
Item.description: Steam Cannon that Fractal Guardians use against intruders. Unfortanatly you can't get it to work as a unexplained mechanism completely shuts down the weapon once its robotic user dies. Researchers pay an alright bounty for each one brought in.

Item.name: Fractal Guardians Dome
Item.description: Broken pieces of the glass dome that housed the Fractal Guardians 'brain'. Researchers pay a fair price, far more than the scrap value.

Item.name: Endworm Tooth
Item.description: One of the many sharp fangs of the Endworm. Holding it could be very dangerous. Deconstructs into titanium, iron, calcium, and magnesium.

Item.name: Endworm Poop
Item.description: Very large worm casting. The holy mother load of fertilizer. Deconstruction seperates out unstable compounds from a large amount of poop suitible for gardening.

Item.name: Matriarch Arms
Item.description: Has a redder tint than the other Hammerheads, much more rubbery and flexible with a strong odor. Can be deconstructed into titanium, calcium, and iron.

Item.name: Matriarch Fins
Item.description: Has a redder tint than the other breeds and has more fins than others. Can be deconstructed into iron, rubber, and aluminium.

Item.name: Matriarch Eye
Item.description: Eye of the Matriarch, its almost the size of a dinner plate. Can be deconstructed into zinc, magnesium, and saline.

Item.name: Latcher Eye
Item.description: Eye of the Latcher. It is souless and hollow and the iris seems to twitch a bit. Can be deconstructed into zinc, magnesium, and saline.

Item.name: Latcher Fangs
Item.description: Huge fangs of the Latcher. Can be deconstructed into titanium, calcium, and iron.

Item.name: Latcher Hair
Item.description: Patches of large fur taken from a Latcher. It looks encrusted with mineral growths and small nodules.

Item.name: Latcher Spike
Item.description: Terrifyingly sharp spike of the latcher. Ranging from various sizes, this one seems oddly sized to the other spikes, allowing it to be used as a makeshift weapon.

Item.name: Moloch Egg
Item.description: An egg of a Moloch. Its heavy and there is something pulsating inside. It takes years for a single Moloch egg to hatch into thousands of them so this egg is currently no use to you, but scientists are willing to buy it at a high price.

Item.name: Black Moloch Egg
Item.description: An egg of a Black Moloch. Its heavy and you feel great dread holding onto it for some reason. It takes years for a single Moloch egg to hatch into thousands of them so this egg is currently no use to you, but scientists are willing to buy it at a high price.

Item.name: Husk Container
Item.description: Rotten chiteneous flesh and mineralized filth forever clings to this container, you really don't want to touch this.

Item.name: Viperling Spike
Item.description: An intact viperling spike, its like metallic carbon fiber inundated with toxic morbusine, you do not want to get stabbed by this.
